column4: hmm... i can't seem to change user config using the Users and Groups applet.  It's locked and most options are disabled
even sudo users-admin doesn't unlock it, the options are still disabled
no unlock button? try sudo su ... then users-admin
the unlock button is there but it's disabled =P
is your user in the sudoers list
yes i can sudo, and sudo su first didn't open the window at all (couldn't open display)
I am using VNC right now ... on a windws machine connected to an ubuntu server - I don't seem to have that prob lem
maybe ubuntu-server has better default settings =P
perhaps - yet i am running a full desktop
are you using a vncserver you installed or are you using the one that comes by default with ubuntu?
that might be why .. I am running vino
vino also uses the real desktop right?  vncserver makes a unique desktop only accessible through vnc (it responds faster than vino)
well I like to come back to my desktop the way I left it

hehe yeah this computer is headless.  I have a desktop with 3 monitors and have one monitor dedicated to a vnc session to this computer (but i can also put windows overtop of it and copy and paste easily between the computers) =)
you might consider x2vnc - allows you to use 1 kb across multiple machines/heads
kinda like synergy? yeah i think i prefer to be able to use all 3 monitors if i want with then one computer =)  thanks anyways though
